result.execSummary:
The defendant Drew C Lara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Obtain GED or HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: To perform 30 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Drew C Lara in court with attorney Cole J White.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misd. Obstructing w/o the repeater enhancer. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. Court dismisses 15-FO-31 & 15-TR-117 but reads in for sentencing purposes. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Drew C Lara in court with attorney Cole J White.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Atty White indicates matter will resolve short of trial, asks court to set a plea/sentencing date. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference at 03-14-2016 11:30 am

Defendant Drew C Lara in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant if he talked to Atty White today. Defendant did talk to Atty White and Atty White indicated to him that he didn't receive notice of todays court date. Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Status conference at 01-28-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Drew C Lara in court with attorney Cole J White. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, previous activity. Defense advises of conversation with State about possibility of global offer.  Status conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Atty White addresses absolute sobriety condition of defendants bond. Atty White asks court to lift that condition of the bond as defendant is now 21 years old.  Court denies request, defendant needs to maintain absolute sobriety. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Drew C Lara in court with attorney Cole J White.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty White will now be representing defendant in 15-CF-123, would like some time to work out a global resolution on both files.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
